title: Nikki Haley to campaign for Loeffler, Perdue in key Georgia Senate races
summary:
Ambassador Nikki Haley will campaign for Sens.
Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue, R-Ga., in a tour of the state on Sunday -- ahead of the state’s runoff races on Jan 5.
Haley will join Loeffler for events in Columbia and Habersham counties, and join both Loeffler and Perdue in Forsyth county on Sunday as part of a Senate Firewall Tour.

paragraphs: EXCLUSIVE: Former U.N. Ambassador Nikki Haley will campaign for Sens. Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue, R-Ga., in a tour of the state on Sunday -- ahead of the state’s runoff races on Jan 5.
Haley will join Loeffler for events in Columbia and Habersham counties, and join both Loeffler and Perdue in Forsyth county on Sunday as part of a Senate Firewall Tour.
NIKKI HALEY'S ADVOCACY GROUP HITS GEORGIA DEM WARNOCK AS 'ANTI-TAXPAYER,' 'PRO-COMMUNIST' RADICAL
"We are so excited to welcome Ambassador Nikki Haley back to the Peach State to campaign for Senator Loeffler," Loeffler deputy campaign manager Stephen Lawson told Fox News.

Haley had campaigned for Loeffler in the general election campaign, where the senator had faced off against Rev. Raphael Warnock and fellow Republican Rep. Doug Collins, R-Ga. With no candidate picking up 50% of the vote, Loeffler and Warnock face one another in the coming runoff race.

Meanwhile, Sen. David Perdue, R-Ga., is seeking re-election against Democrat Jon Ossoff in a separate runoff after Perdue fell just short of 50% in November. Both races have significant national implications, as they will determine which party controls the Senate.

"Ambassador Haley knows that the future of our country is at stake on January 5th, and she's going to continue helping us share Kelly's pro-growth, pro-jobs, pro-police, America First Agenda," Lawson said. "The radical left wants to turn our country into a socialist state, which is why we need every single Georgian to listen to President Trump and get out and vote for Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue."
NIKKI HALEY WARNS OF BERNIE SANDERS AS NEXT BUDGET CHAIR IF DEMS WIN GEORGIA RACES
"We're proud to have Ambassador Haley with us on the ground in Georgia to stop socialism, protect the American Dream, and save our country on January 5th," he said.

Should Republicans win just one of the two races, Republicans will retain the chamber, but if Democrats pick up both seats, then Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer takes charge and Democrats will control both chambers of Congress and the White House.
Haley has already been weighing in on the races.

Last month, her advocacy group -- "Stand for America" launched a scathing video attacking Warnock as "anti-America" "anti-taxpayer" and a "pro-communist" radical, while tearing into his stances on health care and taxes, as well as past remarks on police.
She has also warned conservatives that Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., would be in line to head the Senate Budget Committee if Democrats win the closely watched races.
CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP
Haley is one of a number of big Republican names scheduled to hit Georgia in the coming days.
Vice President Mike Pence will stump for Perdue and Loeffler on Thursday, while Donald Trump Jr. will hold his first in-person events for Perdue on Friday and Saturday.
Fox News’ Tyler Olson contributed to this report.
authors: Adam Shaw Is A Reporter Covering U.S.
European Politics For Fox News. He Can Be Reached Here.
